patient_information: A 33-year-old man from Finland, 180cm, 72kg (reports a 4kg weight loss), who had been backpacking in India for the previous month.
chief_complaint: Passage of loose stools (four or five episodes per day) and flatulence for the past 2 weeks.
history_of_present_illness: Patient reports weight loss, anorexia, malaise, flatulence and abdominal cramping when passing stool. For the past 3 days, he experienced bloating and distension after intake of milk products with an urge to pass stool. He has mild nausea, but no fever. Stools were initially watery; he took ciprofloxacin for 5 days which ended 2 days prior to presentation. Stools are now three or four per day, mushy, greasy and foul-smelling.
exposure_and_epidemiology: A Finnish traveller who had been backpacking in India for the previous month.
physical_exam: Mild non-specific abdominal tenderness. No signs of dehydration. The rest of the examination is normal.
labs_and_diagnostics: Stool for reducing substances: positive. Stool examination for enteric parasites: Giardia trophozoites seen in fresh specimen and Giardia cysts detected on formol-ether concentrated specimens.
management_and_clinical_course: The patient was given tinidazole 2g as a single oral dose. He was advised to restrict milk and high sugar products for 2 weeks and counselled on food and water safety. On review after 3 days, his stool consistency had returned to normal, frequency decreased, nausea absent, and anorexia decreased. He experienced some bloating and discomfort after inadvertently consuming a milk-based dessert but was otherwise feeling much better.
final_diagnosis: Giardiasis with carbohydrate malabsorption (most likely of post-infectious origin).
